page.title: 10FARMING (i)
page.content: Farming is the main industry of the area. Shapley has 1,200 acres if moorland grazing is included;but most farms are less than 100 acres and run on a family basis. Mixed farming is the general rule;beef cattle, sheep, poultry, hay and silage and root crops for winter feed. There is little dairy farming.One newcomer at Buda is now farming sheep and beef,having been put out of business as a milk farmer by the EEC quota system.Breeding for beef,aiming for size and quality, uses chiefly Charolais or Limousin crossed Hereford .The calves run with the mothers for 8 months,then are weaned.Cows calve again within 4 months. Bullocks may be sold at Chagford autumn cattle markets (Aug. and Nov.) or wintered indoors to fetch higher prices in spring,to be balanced against the cost of feeding.
